'Wiley College' is a four-year, private, historically black, liberal arts
college located on the west side of Marshall, in the U.S. state of Texas.
Founded in 1873 by the Methodist Episcopal Church's Bishop Isaac Wiley and
certified in 1882 by the Freedman's Aid Society, it is notable as one of the
oldest predominantly black colleges west of the Mississippi River. www.blackpast.org/?q=aaw/wiley-college-
1873 www.wileyc.edu/history.asp

In 2005â2006, on-campus enrollment approached 450, while an off-campus program
in Shreveport, Louisiana, for students with some prior college credits who seek
to finish a degree enrolled about 250. As of the fall of 2006, total enrollment
was about 750. By autumn of 2009, total enrollment was approximately 1200. Wiley
is an open admissions college and about 96 percent of students receive some
amount of financial aid. http://www.wiley.edu
